abstracts.cdata!:
This Project Paper seeks the approval of
            the Executive Directors to provide an additional grant to
            the Republic of Rwanda for the Multi-Sectoral HIV/AIDS
            Project (H029- 1 -RW). The proposed additional grant would
            help finance the costs associated with an unanticipated
            financing gap and would consolidate the gains from the
            initial investments, focusing on interventions with the most
            significant impact with regard to HIVIAIDS prevention,
            treatment and care. These priority activities are consistent
            with the recently revised National HIV/AIDS Strategic Plan
            and take into account the availability of funding from other
            development partners in an effort to assure harmonization
            and minimize duplication. No changes to the project
            objectives, components, or implementation modalities are
            being proposed. The project remains as originally designed
            and appraised. The proposed changes are marginal and consist
            primarily of updating the costs and financing plan. In
            contrast to the original project which involved co-financing
            with the government, the supplemental grant will finance 100
            percent of the project costs, in line with the new country
            financing parameters for Rwanda.
